decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to be aggressive and use Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using fast mana sources like Eldrazi Temple and Noble Hierarch, as well as efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes some midrange threats like Batterskull and Thragtusk to provide stability in longer games. The goal is to quickly finish off the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board through burn spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike, alongside creatures such as Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and creature pressure. The inclusion of various fetch lands helps to ensure consistent mana fixing for the deck's powerful spells, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost artifact creatures and utilizing artifact lands to swarm the opponent with powerful attackers. By using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck can quickly increase the power and toughness of its creatures, overwhelming the opponent. With the ability to deal direct damage with cards like Galvanic Blast and Vault Skirge, along with the protection from cards like Welding Jar and Etched Champion, the deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive plays and efficient use of resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plays with cards like Lightning Bolt, Path to Exile, and Counter spells like Negate. It also utilizes powerful draw and filtering effects such as Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage to ensure consistency in drawing key cards. To secure the late game, the deck includes win conditions like Celestial Colonnade, Secure the Wastes, Sphinx's Revelation, and Torrential Gearhulk. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control until it can establish a dominant win condition.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. It also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt opponents' strategies with its mix of aggressive creatures and versatile spells. Ultimately, it aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient mana usage to close out the game quickly.

The main concept of this Aggro - Humans deck is to swarm the board with powerful Human creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage. Aether Vial is used to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive game plan while also having disruptive elements to control the game tempo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the efficiency of casting creatures.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells, while ramping up mana with cards like Farseek and Search for Tomorrow. The ultimate goal is to assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal a massive amount of damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes utility cards like Relic of Progenitus and Bring to Light to further manipulate the game state and ensure victory through overwhelming board presence and control.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Twin combo using Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create an infinite loop of hasty tokens for the win. The deck also includes control elements like Cryptic Command, Remand, and Serum Visions to buy time and protect the combo. Blood Moon is included as a disruptive element to slow down opponents, while Snapcaster Mage and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and reach. Jace, the Mind Sculptor is included for card advantage and utility.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with cheap artifact creatures and using various artifacts like Cranial Plating to pump them up for quick damage. It also includes cards like Galvanic Blast for removal and reach, as well as Etched Champion for protection against removal spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and resilient threats. Additionally, the deck includes lands like Blinkmoth Nexus and Inkmoth Nexus, as well as Mox Opal for mana acceleration and color fixing.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and resilient threat by stacking auras on hexproof creatures, such as Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout, to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The combination of efficient auras like Rancor, Ethereal Armor, and Daybreak Coronet enhances the creatures' power and toughness while also providing them with additional abilities. Leyline of Sanctity protects the player from targeted discard spells and burn, allowing them to focus on building up their board state. The deck aims to win through aggressive combat damage and avoiding removal with hexproof and protection auras.

The core strategy of this Aggro - Humans deck is to quickly build a board presence by playing efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Meddling Mage, Kitesail Freebooter, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to control the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, while cards like Phantasmal Image and Reflector Mage provide additional utility and flexibility. The mana base is optimized for playing Human creatures with cards like Ancient Ziggurat and Unclaimed Territory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with aggressive Human creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures like Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider, supported by mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial. Additionally, protection from counter spells is provided by Cavern of Souls, ensuring the Humans can hit the battlefield safely and efficiently.

The deck focuses on using cycling creatures like Monstrous Carabid and Street Wraith to quickly fill up the graveyard, then casting Living End to bring them back into play for a powerful board wipe and potential win condition. The deck also includes cards like Fulminator Mage to disrupt opponents' mana bases and Faerie Macabre to exile key cards from opponents' graveyards. The goal is to set up a strong board presence while disrupting opponents' strategies, leading to a decisive victory through overwhelming force.

This Mardu Aggro deck aims to aggressively control the board with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Kolaghan's Command to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes token generation from cards like Lingering Souls and Young Pyromancer to create a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. Bedlam Reveler provides a powerful finisher to close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek, while also utilizing cards like Search for Tomorrow and Primeval Titan to search for specific lands. The ultimate goal is to assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's life total in one turn. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Bloodbraid Elf serve as additional removal and value generators to help survive until the combo can be executed.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw until it can cheat out a powerful threat like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using Through the Breach. The inclusion of Blood Moon can disrupt opponent's mana bases, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and control. Snapcaster Mage allows for spells to be recast from the graveyard, and Lightning Bolt provides additional removal. The deck aims to stall the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition.
